column4: blast!!!  the same error!!  wth does this mean???  dpkg-buildpackage: command not found

I'm trying to install drivers for an ATI Radeon 9800 pro, no matter what I try, whether its the file I got from ATI or a manual install, I get this error:  ./packages/Ubuntu/ati-packager.sh: line 86: dpkg-buildpackage: command not found
Anyone in here who can help me with missing packages?
I've got an error message that I've got no clue about, and when I google it, I get nothing
anyone have a working ATI driver that can help me out?
anyone have a working ATI driver installed that can help me?
anyone have a working ATI driver installed that can help me?
,   i followed the binary driver wiki and got it working in a few min.
I tried that, but I got errors last time
I run this command from the wiki page:  sudo apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx
I get this error:  E: Couldn't find package xorg-driver-fglr
I'm not sure where apt is pointing to, but thats what happens
you need to set up the otther repositories Is my guess. to include the universe/multiverse places most likely.
Oh!!! I see...  I'm not new to linux, but I'm new to Ubuntu, you hafta take out the comments so the update terminal can use them!!
okay, so I run sudo apt-get update, I have to do sudo apt-get upgrade??
